thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Designs MULTI PORT (TPA-2174)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Designs MULTI PORT (TPA-2174) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Designs MULTI PORT (TPA-2174)
text:
Founded in 1984, InventHelp is working to submit the MULTI PORT to companies in the hopes of a good faith review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 26, 2015
Do you wish there was a simple and easy way to charge various electronic devices and instantaneously surf on the "World Wide Web" in the home or office? An inventor, from Spring Hill, Fla., thought there needed to be a better way, so he invented the patent-pending MULTI PORT.
The MULTI PORT provides an improved way to charge AC loads and mobile electronic products, along with instantaneously bridging wireless devices to the "World Wide Web." In doing so, it helps to simplify the charging process. It expands instant access to the Internet and increases AC port usage. It simplifies electronic charging capabilities, and it offers an easier method to connect plug-in style power components. The invention features an efficient design that is convenient and easy to use so it is ideal for households, offices and businesses. Additionally, the MULTI PORT is producible in design variations.
The inventor described the invention design. "My design will enhance charging and appliance capabilities by expanding the use of outlet ports, as well as revolutionizing the way a home connects to the World Wide Web."
The original design was submitted to the Tampa office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-TPA-2174, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
